meanings.definition: Concerned with beauty or the appreciation of beauty.
meanings.sent1: The painting had an aesthetical appeal that caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: She had an aesthetical taste in choosing colors for her artwork.
meanings.sent3: The aesthetical arrangement of flowers in the garden made the neighbors smile.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted an aesthetical masterpiece across the sky.
meanings.sent5: The aesthetical design of the building made it stand out in the cityscape.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the philosophy of aesthetics.
meanings.sent1: His aesthetical analysis of the sculpture delved deep into its meaning.
meanings.sent2: The book club discussed the aesthetical aspects of the novel.
meanings.sent3: The aesthetical debate among the artists sparked interesting conversations.
meanings.sent4: Her outfit had an aesthetical connection to the historical fashion trends.
meanings.sent5: The museum's exhibit showcased various aesthetical theories in art.

meanings.definition: Characterized by a sense of beauty.
meanings.sent1: The garden had an aesthetical charm that enchanted visitors.
meanings.sent2: The aesthetical nature of the poem resonated with the audience.
meanings.sent3: The aesthetical atmosphere of the room created a peaceful vibe.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an aesthetical reflection of her inner joy.
meanings.sent5: The aesthetical landscape painting captured the essence of the countryside.
